title: Yellowstone National Park: Wandering Garter Snake
body: Wandering Garter Snake        A wandering garter snake near Mammoth Hot Springs NPS/Neal Herbert       Scientific Name Thamnophis elegans vagrans Identification  Most common reptile in the park. 6 to 30 inches long. Brown, brownish green, or gray with three light stripes—one running the length of the back and a stripe on each side.  Habitat  Usually found near water in all areas of the park. Eats small rodents, fish, frogs, tadpoles, salamanders, earthworms, slugs, snails, and leeches.  Behavior  May discharge musk from glands at the base of the tale when threatened. Gives birth to as many as 20 live young in late summer or fall.        More Information  More on Reptiles: Bull Snake, Prairie Rattlesnake, Rubber Boa, Sagebrush Lizard, Valley Garter Snake, and Wandering Garter Snake Safely Watch Wildlife
